column4: why is ubuntu such a resource hog? Drag n dropping is lagged, and sometimes I need to try few times until I succed using it, when no apps are running still about 400mb of memory is used wth?
can someone explain it to me?
it is
yeah thats how ubuntu is
you could try other distros like arch
but they aint easy to use or administer like ubuntu
arch would take too much time to do simple things
yes
ubuntu is just slow, xp is thousand times faster
you could try removing some apps runing in background
thats not correct, how much ram you ahve?
not true in my case
windows xp will slow down over time you will have noticed, ubuntu stays same
tell us your system specs
turn off desktop effects to get more speed
I had perfectly solid xp for few years with no performance drop, just ned to clean things from time to time
well,in xp the file system gets fragmented over time, so it surely gets slower from the  time you install it
ubuntu doesnt need defrags
i repeat, tell us your system specs
so I tell once again
and which version of ubuntu
is compix on?
I disable it for gaming or flash movies
compiz is a resource hog
i never use it
compiz is worthless and unefficient
yes
so is gnome
then try kde
I didn't like kde, it seemed like even more unefficient
xfce is kinda cool but I would need a clean install to get it going perfectly, cuz it's just a mess
do you have an intel graphics chip?
no NVIDIA 7800GT GF
aah sorry yes
so i see no reason why you should have a slow system, i have 1 gb ram only
although firefox on linux is slower than windows version
not that it boots slow or something, because it's decent
I do not use ff cuz I hate it :P
yes i have moved to chrome
so if you could go step by step and remove some things from startup apps, maybe you could speed up
but yes ubuntu is slower than other distros like arch or maybe gentoo
I already did
then i guess its as fast as it can be
I think maybe 64 bit is not supported well
dont worry about the ram, its a little diff from windows
no, iam on 64 bit, its same
on xp cpu usage is perfectly 0-1%
in ubuntu it oscilates around 15%
yes cpu should be used, thats why we have it isnt it
hmm, you're right :P
a browser will stress the cpu upto 30 percent i have seen on startup,then flash etc push to 100
so just open system monitoer and tell me usage now
flash is worthless, nothing much to do with it, decent enough to watch windowed, fullscreen is choppy
if you can find flash 9 , install that, its awesome
i searched but cant find the older one
then upload it for me :)
both cores usage oscilates arround 30-50%
firefox running? what is running and using it ?check in processes
Opera, XChat, and Evolution opened
the cpu should oscillate at 50
Opera uses from 6 to 16% cpu
evolution 20mbs Opera about 200mbs :P
heh opera is using the flash and the tabs you have opened is a lot i feel
indeed youtube is open
friend of mine has averange memory usage of 1gb on lone firefox
lol thats some bug then
but he has lots, and I mean LOTS of tabs :P
yes the tabs can take up mem ,
but i dont think firefox can handle it
2 tabs 222 mbs no flash atm
222 is normal, remember, linux uses ram in a diff way and reports it so
its not all what you think
it's just when I want to play ET: Quake Wars I want possibly full resources put into running the game
i play quAKE 4
not some other tasks which are pointless when I am playing
works like a char,
QW also works awesome, but I am just a frames per second maniac
if you dont need evolution i suggest you remove that stupid evo data server from processes
I play it in high details
I like evolution, there are 2 processes some data-server thingy and some exchange-storage thingy
they both eat about 6mb ram so it's not a problem
but dunno if I need them
where do I put flashplugin for firefox to find it
you said you had flash already
just want to do a benchmark with new alpha version of 10.1 and firefox which I don't use
firefox is a retarded browser
do not say that
I tried to put it in so many locations and ff still doesn't use flashplugin
install if from the package manager dude
as I said I am testing a beta release of 10.1
alpha2 support in #ubuntu+1
try not to use such language for projects like firefox
sure
can I uninstall compiz just like that without making amess?
yes of course
